030package javax.measure.spi;
031
032import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
033
034import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.*;
035
036import java.util.Collection;
037
038import javax.measure.BinaryPrefix;
039import javax.measure.MetricPrefix;
040import javax.measure.Prefix;
041import javax.measure.Quantity;
042
043/**
044 * Tests for {@link ServiceProvider}.
045 */
046public class ServiceProviderTest {
047
048    @Test
049    public void testSetCurrentNull() {
050        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> {
051            ServiceProvider.setCurrent(null);
052        });
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Tests {@link ServiceProvider#current()} and {@link ServiceProvider#setCurrent(ServiceProvider)}. The getter and setter are tested in a single
057     * method for avoiding issues with the order in which JUnit executes tests.
058     */
059    @Test
060    public void testGetAndSetCurrent() {
061        assertEquals(0, ServiceProvider.available().size());
062        try {
063            ServiceProvider.current();
064            fail("Expected no ServiceProvider before we set one.");
065        } catch (IllegalStateException e) {
066            // This is the expected exception.
067        }
068        ServiceProvider testProv = new TestServiceProvider();
069        assertNull(ServiceProvider.setCurrent(testProv), "Expected no ServiceProvider before we set one.");
070        assertSame(testProv, ServiceProvider.setCurrent(testProv), "Setting the same ServiceProvider twice should be a no-op.");
071        assertSame(testProv, ServiceProvider.current());
072        assertArrayEquals(new ServiceProvider[] { testProv }, ServiceProvider.available().toArray());
073        assertNotNull(ServiceProvider.of("TestServiceProvider"));
074    }
075
076    /**
077     * Tests {@link ServiceProvider#getPriority()}.
078     */
079    @Test
080    public void testPriority() {
081        assertEquals(0, ServiceProvider.current().getPriority());
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Tests ServiceProvider#of() by passing null.
086     */
087    @Test
088    public void testOfNull() {
089        assertThrows(NullPointerException.class, () -> {
090            @SuppressWarnings("unused")
091            ServiceProvider dummy = ServiceProvider.of(null);
092        });
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * Tests ServiceProvider#of() by passing a non-existing name.
097     */
098    @Test
099    public void testOfNonExistent() {
100        assertThrows(IllegalArgumentException.class, () -> {
101            @SuppressWarnings("unused")
102            ServiceProvider dummy = ServiceProvider.of("ThisServiceProviderWillNeverExistHere");
103        });
104    }
105
106    @Test
107    public void testGetMetricPrefixes() {
108        final ServiceProvider testProv = new TestServiceProvider();
109        final SystemOfUnitsService service = testProv.getSystemOfUnitsService();
110        Collection<MetricPrefix> prefixes = service.getPrefixes(MetricPrefix.class);
111        assertNotNull(prefixes);
112        assertEquals(20, prefixes.size());
113    }
114
115    @Test
116    public void testGetBinaryPrefixes() {
117        final ServiceProvider testProv = new TestServiceProvider();
118        final SystemOfUnitsService service = testProv.getSystemOfUnitsService();
119        assertNotNull(service);
120        Collection<BinaryPrefix> prefixes = service.getPrefixes(BinaryPrefix.class);
121        assertNotNull(prefixes);
122        assertEquals(8, prefixes.size());
123    }
124
125    @Test
126    public void testWrongPrefixType() {
127        final ServiceProvider testProv = new TestServiceProvider();
128        final SystemOfUnitsService service = testProv.getSystemOfUnitsService();
129        assertNotNull(service);
130        assertThrows(ClassCastException.class, () -> {
131            @SuppressWarnings({ "unused", "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
132            Collection<Prefix> prefixes = service.getPrefixes((Class) String.class);
133        });
134
135    }
136
137    @Test
138    public void testWrongEnumType() {
139        final ServiceProvider testProv = new TestServiceProvider();
140        final SystemOfUnitsService service = testProv.getSystemOfUnitsService();
141        assertNotNull(service);
142        assertThrows(ClassCastException.class, () -> {
143            @SuppressWarnings({ "unused", "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
144            Collection<Prefix> prefixes = service.getPrefixes((Class) DummyEnum.class);
145        });
146    }
147
148    private static final class TestServiceProvider extends ServiceProvider {
149
150        @Override
151        public SystemOfUnitsService getSystemOfUnitsService() {
152            return new TestSystemOfUnitsService();
153        }
154
155        @Override
156        public <Q extends Quantity<Q>> QuantityFactory<Q> getQuantityFactory(Class<Q> quantity) {
157            return null;
158        }
159
160        @Override
161        public FormatService getFormatService() {
162            return null;
163        }
164
165        @Override
166        public String toString() {
167            return "TestServiceProvider";
168        }
169    }
170
171    private static enum DummyEnum {
172        A, B
173    }
174}
